page.title: 01SOUTH EAST BOLTON
page.content: The area of {SOUTH-EAST BOLTON} to be examined contains LEVERHULME PARK, THE HAULGH, ROSE HILL,SPRINGFIELD and BURNDEN is a mixture of RESIDENTIAL, PARKLAND, INDUSTRY and DERELICT LAND. The RESEDENTIAL LAND consists of new and old houses and has two{HISTORIC {BUILDINGS;}HAULGH HALL, a small 17th century MANOR HOUSE built in the 'CRUCK STYLE' and PARK COTTAGE or 'TWO CATS', as it is known, the home of FTED DIBNAH, Bolton's famous STEEPLEJACK. On the edge of LEVERHULME PARK is a TERRA COTTA built church ST. STEPHEN AND ALL MARTYRS CHURCH OF ENGLAND. About one hundred metres from the church is LEVER BRIDGE VIADUCT which has supported a railway line from Bolton to Bury, but which has not been used for over 25 years.
